route.name: Elmwood

route.name: Late Night Express Service
route.copy:
Take Metro downtown on weekends

Students from Buffalo State, Bryant & Stratton, Canisius College, ECC City Campus, Medaille College and the general public are all invited to try Metro's Late Night Express Service, Route 20E, to Buffalo's downtown entertainment districts.

WHEN:

Thursday and Saturday from 10:00 p.m. to 4:30 a.m.

While school is in session. 20E does not run during Thanksgiving weekend, Christmas and Spring breaks.

Service starts the Buffalo State College campus with stops on Rockwell near the Twin Rise & Porter Hall, and on Iroquois Drive at Moore Complex, then to the 198, stopping next at Medaille College. From there, the bus travels to Canisius College, Delavan Townhouses and on Main Street at Eastwood, then back on the 198, back to Elmwood and downtown to Chippewa.

Here's what you need to do to ride this service:

See the attached map of pick up and drop off locations near the college you attend.

Look for the Metro Bus Stop sign at that location with the number 20E on it.

Buses will pick you up at any Metro bus stop along the route from 10:00 p.m. to 3:30 a.m.

- Last bus leaves Delaware & Chippewa at 4:00 a.m.
- Service is open door and open to the general public.
- College Students with a valid College ID from schools participating in Unlimited Access ride FREE of charge.

Students will be required to swipe their valid Metro-College/University Unlimited Access ID cards upon boarding the bus or they will be charged regular Metro fare.

route.copy: Running times have been adjusted. Weekday 11:08 p.m. inbound trip changed to 11:02 p.m. for connection with Route 19 at Bailey and Genesee per passenger request. Eliminated 9 Sunday trips due to low ridership creating a 40-45 minute interval for Sunday service.

Starting Dec. 26 - All trips serve the new Niagara Falls Airport. Only 55A and B trips now serve The Summit. Transfers should be made at the Airport Transit Center.

route.name: Trolley
route.copy:
Route 55/55T Supplement
click here for color code information


For Niagara Falls information visit www.niagara-usa.com

(these are not the trolleys that run through Niagara Falls State Park)

Trolley Route 55T serves Niagara Falls Blvd., Pine Ave. and downtown Niagara Falls USA. Guests of participating hotels ride free all day, including transfers to Metro Bus or Metro Rail. Trolley Day Passes are available at participating hotel registration desks. Day Passes are valid for use on the date punched by the Metro operator. (Other valid Metro passes can also be used on the 55T Trolley.) Passengers without a Trolley Day Pass from a hotel may use the service for $1.75 per ride, which can be paid upon boarding. Children ages 5-11, senior citizens (age 65+), disabled and Medicare card holders with valid I.D. pay 75 cents. Exact change is required on trolleys and buses.

Route 55T service is offered everyday from June-September. Service will be offered weekends only May 14-31 and October 1-11 (including Memorial Day and Columbus Day). Trolleys operate from 9 a.m. until Midnight. Stops are indicated with Route 55T signs as shown on the map.

  • Trolley Day Passes are also valid on regular Metro Route 55 buses which run between downtown Niagara Falls and hotels/motels along Pine Ave and Niagara Falls Blvd.
  • Trolley stops closest to the Falls and State Reservation are on Rainbow Blvd. at Michael O’Laughlin Dr. and near Old Falls St.
  • For return trips to the Niagara Falls Blvd. hotels/motels board 55T trolleys at any of the downtown stops. Returning trolleys will have a ‘Niagara Falls Airport’ destination sign in the front window. Ask the trolley operator if you are not sure
  • A regular Metro bus maybe substituted for a trolley bus on occasion. Look at the route sign on the front of the bus. If it reads 55T PINE AVE and 55T TROLLEY, it is a bus running a trolley bus route.

route.copy: Eliminated 6 trips, interval adjusted from 60 to 90 minutes.

route.name: Niagara Falls
route.copy: Starting Oct. 31 This route will run between the Portage Road Transit Center and downtown Buffalo via the Niagara Falls Transit Center, The I-190 and Grand Island Boulevard. The 60B variation using Hyde Park Blvd and Buffalo Avenue is discontinued. There are two trips during peak hours in the morning and three trips in the late afternoon.

route.name:
Portage Road
Transportation Center
route.copy:
Get me to the game - Buffalo Bills
Fast, comfortable bus service direct to Ralph Wilson Stadium, for every Buffalo Bills home game.

Service leaves two hours before game time

Route 90 - Portage Road Transportation Center, Portage and Chilton.


Fares
Fare for Game Day Express is the same as general Metro service. A Metro Day Pass, Weekend Pass, or College University Pass is valid. Cash fares, are as follows (one way and two way):

 
One way
Round trip
Route 90
$1.75
$3.50
